title: MIT Energy Conference U.S. China Energy Transition

yaml.title: MIT Energy Conference U.S. China Energy Transition
yaml.description: Gang joins experts to discuss U.S. China Energy Transition.
yaml.author: MIT Energy Conference

markdown.markdown:
Welcome to join us for a discussion on parallels between the US and China’s energy transition landscapes. [![](featured.jpeg){fig-align="center"}](https://mitenergyconference.org/agenda)

Get your tickets to the MIT Energy Conference: https://t.co/k01jKefeaG. We are pleased to announce another panel discussion: US-China Energy Transition, which will discuss parallels between the US and China’s energy transition landscapes, with a focus on the innovation ecosystem. pic.twitter.com/UFdLzeP54V

— MIT Energy Conference (@MITEnergyConf) March 3, 2023
## Related Papers - Helveston, John Paul, Gang He, and Michael R. Davidson. 2022. [Quantifying the Cost Savings of Global Solar Photovoltaic Supply Chains](/posts/2022-10-nature-cost-savings-of-global-solar-pv-value-chains/index.qmd). *Nature* 612 (7938): 83–87. doi: [10.1038/s41586-022-05316-6](https://doi.org/10.1038/s41586-022-05316-6). - He, Gang, Jiang Lin, Froylan Sifuentes, Xu Liu, Nikit Abhyankar, and Amol Phadke. 2020. [Rapid Cost Decrease of Renewables and Storage Accelerates the Decarbonization of China’s Power System](/posts/2020-05-ncomms-rapid-re-cost/index.qmd). *Nature Communications* 11(1): 2486. doi: [10.1038/s41467-020-16184-x](https://doi.org/10.1038/s41467-020-16184-x). {{< include /files/includes/_socialshare.qmd >}}

metadata.description-meta: Samee Ullah is a Computational Structural Biologist and a former Bioinformatician at National Institute of Health. He studies the protein and nucleic acids structures, dynamics and interaction with small molecules using the state of the art methods of Molecular dynamics simulations, and physics based binding energy calculations.
